body: @metroid Fair enough, but it still hits me in the feels because I end up reading from the cuck's POV. @nchris Barely exists as in, he doesn't have an established character. He's just "that guy". On the other hand, the part-timer actually has enough presence to be, for lack of a better word, empathized with. And if you're bothered by the husband being mocked... It's like being bothered by a villain getting beaten up. It's to be expected. Although maybe that's just me not being nice enough to care for every single person's feelings.
i want to translat this manga Itsumo Boku o Mamotte Kureru Osananajimi ga Boku o Ijimeteita Yatsu to SEX Shimakutteita Ken Kouhen

@DanteΩ well netori barely exists too and we empathize with him right?, anyways "empathy" was not the correct word, maybe. What i mean is that i enjoyed this work  because as you say netori is the protagonist here, but in the parts I mentioned earlier, the focus on the weak and stupid husband is high and I can't help but feel angry.
